page.title: 08Farming Around East Dean
page.content:
All the farmland belongs to Goodwood Estate and the farmers are tenants. There are two mixed farms at East Dean. New House Farm comprimises 340 acres, some of which is used for cereal growing. There is a flock of 650 pedigree South Down sheep and a herd of 75 Aberdeen Angus cattle.
Droke Farm comprises 1,000 acres, 600 of which is arable, mainly cereals. The rest of the land is for running the cattle, 200 head of beef, 100 dairy cows and 150 young stock. Goodwood estate farms the land at Charlton. Sheep and cattle graze some fields but the majority is used for cereal growing. The woodland at Charlton is used for breeding game birds for the winter 'shooting' season. They belong to Manor Farm at Singleton.
